intro: Quelusia, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and stream banks. Quelusia has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along its stem. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
